page.title: 04WOODLAND, HIGH HAM AND AREA
page.content: There are several areas of forest and woodland within the block: Aller Wood in the S.W. corner, Turn Hill and Beer Wood in the N. and Blackham Wood to the N.E. are all woods dominated by deciduous trees. Breach Wood, to the S.W. is mainly coniferous. Children from High Ham Primary School surveyed 8 random areas of forest and woodland. 10 types of tree were found in the sample areas. Ash, field maple and hawthorn trees predominate. There are also a number of hazel, elderberry, sycamore and beech. Oak, sloe and rowan trees are found individually within wooded areas.Turn Hill, to the N.W., National Trust land, also has several ornamental trees e.g. apple and laburnam. Breach Wood at Bowdens, to the S.W., is an area of cultivated forest. It is a coniferous forest covering approximately 100 hectares.
